quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Nero Wolfe and Rye
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, salingers, newspaperman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mark David Chapman was found with a copy of The Catcher in the Rye on the night he shot this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Who was the love interest of Nero Wolfes right-hand man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lily Rowan

questions.question: Who was the newspaperman who helped fictional detective Nero Wolfe on occasion, and was one of the regular poker players.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lon Cohen

questions.question: Who was Nero Wolfes right-hand man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archie Goodwin

questions.question: Where was fictional detective Nero Wolfe born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montenegro

questions.question: What was the name of Nero Wolfes fictional chef who lived in the basement of Wolfes brownstone and also served as majordomo and butler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fritz Brenner

questions.question: What was written on Allies left-handed baseball glove, one of the most significant symbols in the novel The Catcher in the Rye?

options.text: the name of his first girlfriend
the titles of his favourite books

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: poems

questions.question: What beverage did detective Nero Wolfe consume copious amounts of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beer

questions.question: Fictional detective Nero Wolfe lived in a brownstone on West 34th Street in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In this Academy Award-winning movie, Woody Allens character says that he only has books with the word death or dying in them. Diane Keatons character holds a copy of The Catcher in the Rye and asks, What about this one?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie Hall

questions.question: Which of the following was not one of the regular gang of fictional detectives Nero Wolfe regularly used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purley Stebbins

questions.question: What was the name of Nero Wolfes nemesis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Zeck

questions.question: What was Nero Wolfes hobby, which he engaged in for four hours each day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raising orchids

questions.question: What color shirt did Nero Wolfe invariably wear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: J. D. Salingers novel The Catcher in the Rye opens in the week before this major holiday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christmas

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Story and Agatha Christies
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the cigar-chomping fictional police inspector who had a love-hate relationship with Nero Wolfe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cramer

questions.question: Which story is listed with the WRONG author?

options.text: The Gift of Cochise-Leo G. Carroll

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gift of Cochise-Leo G. Carroll

questions.question: What is the essential element of a short story?

options.text: The description of scenery  is used to paint a complete picture.
They open with a historic scene.
The complete description of  the main characters psyche is used to set  the scene.
A short period of time is covered.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A short period of time is covered.

questions.question: Which term refers to a prose fiction work that is longer than a short story but shorter than a novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A novella

questions.question: Which short story is  listed with the WRONG author?

options.text: The Death of Ivan Ilych-Leo Tolstoy
The Life in the Iron Mills-Rebecca H. Davis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death in the Afternoon-John Steinbeck

questions.question: Which short story ids listed with the WRONG author?

options.text: Love in Old Clothes-H. C. Bunner
The Attack on the Mill-Emile Zola

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Man Called Horse-Louis LAmour

questions.question: What does the blue geranium mean according to the fortuneteller in Agatha Christies exciting short story The Blue Geranium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death

questions.question: Who killed the French Deputy Paul Deroulard in Agatha Christies short story The Chocolate Box?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His mother

questions.question: How does Mr Bleibner die in Agatha Christies short story The Adventure of the Egyptian Tomb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood poisoning

questions.question: What is The Western Star from Agatha Christies short story The Adventure of The Western Star?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A jewel

questions.question: Who is the murderer in Agatha Christies The Tragedy at Marsdon Manor?

options.text: The lover of the dead mans wife
The widow of the dead man
The brother of the dead man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The widow of the dead man

questions.question: What does Miss Violet Marsh have to do in order to inherit her Uncle Andrews possessions in Agatha Christies story The Case of the Missing Will?

options.text: Live as a beggar for one month
Remain unmarried for the rest of her life

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prove her wits

questions.question: Which short story is listed with the WRONG author?

options.text: The Devil and Daniel Webster-Stephen Vincent  Benet
The Spinoza of Market Street-Isaac Bashevis Singer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Devils Advocate-John Grisham

questions.question: What type of poison does Mrs. Merrowdene use in Agatha Christies short story Accident?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arsenic

questions.question: Which story is listed with the CORRECT author?

options.text: The Man Without a Country-E. E. Hale

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Man Without a Country-E. E. Hale

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Grapes and Wrath
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, agatha, director. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was the novel The Grapes of Wrath first published?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1939

questions.question: Who wrote the novel The Grapes of Wrath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Steinbeck

questions.question: What is the name of the main family in the novel The Grapes of Wrath and in the movie adaptation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joad

questions.question: Where do the main characters travel in the novel The Grapes of Wrath?

options.text: From Chicago, Illinois to San Joaquin, California

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From Oklahoma to California

questions.question: In the original movie The Grapes of Wrath, the part of Jim Casey, the ex-minister is played by an actor  with this last name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carradine

questions.question: In the The Grapes of Wrath, we meet the first character, Tom, as he walks and hitchhikes home. Why is he away from home?

options.text: He served time in prison for burglary.
He served time in prison for homicide.
He had no money for the subway, so he had to walk home.
He lost his job in the Chicago slaughterhouses and had to walk the two miles to the Adams home.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He served time in prison for homicide.

questions.question: What statement about the novel The Grapes of Wrath is true?

options.text: The author of the novel won neither the Nobel Prize for Literature nor the Pulitzer Prize for Literature.
The author of the novel won the Nobel Prize for Literature but not the Pulitzer Prize for Literature.
The author of the novel won the Pulitzer Prize for Literature and the Nobel Prize for Literature.
The author of the novel won the Pulitzer Prize for Literature but not the Nobel Prize for Literature.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The author of the novel won the Pulitzer Prize for Literature and the Nobel Prize for Literature.

questions.question: Which of these words best describes the attitudes of the novel The Grapes of Wrath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pro-labor

questions.question: What is the plant employed for the murder in Agatha Christies The Herb of Death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foxglove

questions.question: When was the original movie The Grapes of Wrath released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1940

questions.question: What work by Alexandre Dumas, Sr. inspired Hercules Poirot how to solve the case in  The Augean Stables?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Queens Necklace

questions.question: What word was written with a capital letter in the middle of a sentence in the letter from some Georgine in Agatha Christies story The Four Suspects?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honesty

questions.question: Which best describes the plot of the novel The Grapes of Wrath?

options.text: A middle-class family lose their home and must move to the Southwest to get work and stability.
A poor familys city home is foreclosed and they must travel to the mid-west to get work.
A poor family lose their home and farm and  travel West looking for work.
A poor family move from their Texas ranch to get work in the agricultural areas of California.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A poor family lose their home and farm and  travel West looking for work.

questions.question: The director of the original film version of The Grapes of Wrath won an Oscar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How did the author of The Grapes of Wrath come up with the title of the novel?

options.text: The author picked it out of The Bible.
The authors wife suggested he use a line from a song.
Marie Hemingway had published a poem containing the line  .. and the grapes of wrath poured forth from Pandoras box....
When the author was growing up in Mississippi, it  was a common expression for mans  troubles.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The authors wife suggested he use a line from a song.

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Grapes and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, cabell, poet. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What animal is used in the novel The Grapes of Wrath to symbolize the familys problems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turtle

questions.question: The novel The Grapes of Wrath was made into an opera.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What poet, noted for his realistic depictions of rural life, received four Pulitzer Prizes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Frost

questions.question: In 1918, politician William Cabell Bruce won the Pulitzer Prize for the biography of this Founding Father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Franklin

questions.question: The Pulitzer Prize, established by newspaper publisher Joseph Pulitzer, is administered by  this American university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbia University

questions.question: Newspaper magnates Joseph Pulitzer and William Hearst are regarded as the originators of this type of journalism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: yellow journalism

questions.question: What Gus Van Sant movie mentions a fictional Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, titled Avalon Landing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finding Forrester

questions.question: One of the characters in the novel and movie The Grapes of Wrath had this unusual name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose of Sharon

questions.question: This Pulitzer Prize-winning work, written in Cuba by Ernest Hemingway, was also an important factor in Hemingways selection for the 1954 Nobel Prize in Literature.

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.question: Which of these performers did not write a song based on the novel The Grapes of Wrath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: What two objects are used in the novel The Grapes of Wrath to symbolize evil?

options.text: the tractor and the slot machine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the tractor and the slot machine

questions.question: Which of the following banned the movie The Grapes of Wrath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josef Stalin

questions.question: What does the name Hudson have to do with the novel The Grapes of Wrath?

options.text: It is the name of the family the Adams live with in Texas.
It is the brand of car the family uses for transportation.
It is the name of the Texas ranch where the family gets part-time labor.
It is the name of the cruel Illinois governor whose laws force the Darwells out of Chicago.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the brand of car the family uses for transportation.

questions.question: Find the correct statement about the original movie The Grapes of Wrath.

options.text: The character of Nick Adams was played by Robert J. Douglas.
The director refused to let anyone use makeup for the movie.
The producer had to raise $5,000,000 to make this movie.
Frank Galatai was portrayed by Robert J. Douglas.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The director refused to let anyone use makeup for the movie.

questions.question: What author, born in the American South, won the Pulitzer Prize for her only novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harper Lee

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Lyra
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, pullmans, fields. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In His Dark Materials trilogy, what can be the subtle knife used for?

options.text: To cut through anything, even metals, stones and souls.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In the second His Dark Materials book, how does the subtle knife indicate who it has chosen to be his bearer?

options.text: It leaves a scar across his forehead.
It cuts off the pinky and ring fingers on one hand.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It cuts off the pinky and ring fingers on one hand.

questions.question: In The Subtle Knife, what is the name by which the witches call Lyra, that if known by the wrong people, could mean her destruction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eve

questions.question: Who composed Blood on the Fields, the first piece of jazz music to win the Pulitzer Prize for Music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wynton Marsalis

questions.question: In the book Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing, what big account did Peters father lose because of Fudge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juicy-O

questions.question: In the book The Subtle Knife what is the name of the city Lyra finds herself in, in the new world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CittGazze

questions.question: Which of the following authors is not a recipient of both the Pulitzer Prize and the Nobel Prize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doris Lessing

questions.question: Who portrays Joseph Pulitzer, the founder of the Pulitzer Prize, in the 1992 Disney film musical, Newsies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Duvall

questions.question: Does Will ever find his father in His Dark Materials trilogy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In The Subtle Knife” Angelica’s younger brother is Paolo. Who is her older brother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tullio

questions.question: What city does the typical family of four reside in in the classic story Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: In Phillip Pullmans The Subtle Knife, who does Lyra, the protagonist of the first book, meet first in the new world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Will

questions.question: In the book, The Subtle Knife by Phillip Pullman, who is Will Parrys father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stanislaus Grumman

questions.question: What does the alethiometer tell Lyra she must do, in the book The Subtle Knife?

options.text: Search for a scholar who knows about dust

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Help Will find his father

questions.question: In Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing, what was the name of the turtle Peter got at Jimmy Fargos birthday party?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dribble

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mezzanine and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, turtle, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is Fudges real name in the novel Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Farley Drexel Hatcher

questions.question: Where does most of the action in the novel The Mezzanine take place?

options.text: In line at the office supply store.
On a park bench outside the office.
On the escalator in the Mezzanine.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the protagonists mind

questions.question: How much time elapses diegetically ( within the story )  in the novel The Mezzanine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 to 3 minutes.

questions.question: What classic line does Fudge say in Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing when his mom discovers her flowers are missing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ALL GONE yum yum

questions.question: When does the action in the novel, The Mezzanine take place?

options.text: During the protagonists morning commute to work

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: During the protagonists lunch hour

questions.question: What happened when Fudge fell off the jungle gym in Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing?

options.text: He swallowed his top front teeth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He swallowed his top front teeth.

questions.question: What object in the mens room does the author discuss in great detail in the novel The Mezzanine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The hand drying air machine.

questions.question: According to the protagonist in The Mezzanine, how did the world change irrevocably in 1970?

options.text: New TVs increased the number of pixels, leading to greater picture quality and resolution.
The rise of the Womens Movement in the US changed workplace ethics in the office forever.
Drinking straws switched from being made of paper to being made of plastic.
Introduction of the B-747 jet aircraft shrunk the globe in terms of air travel.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drinking straws switched from being made of paper to being made of plastic.

questions.question: Why does the protagonist buy new shoelaces in the novel, The Mezzanine?

options.text: Hes buying them for a co-worker.
He broke one earlier that morning.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He broke one earlier that morning.

questions.question: Who said there was a missing four-year-old in the building?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a security guard

questions.question: What is the protagonists occupation in the novel, The Mezzanine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Office Worker

questions.question: How old is Peter in Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: What did Fudges father dump on top of his head in the book Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cornflakes

questions.question: Which of the following does not happen with the protagonist in the novel, The Mezzanine?

options.text: He sits on a park bench across from the office.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He eats a hamburger

questions.question: What did Fudge do to Peters turtle in the book Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing?

options.text: He dropped it out of the window.
He hit it with a hammer.
He took it for a walk.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He swallowed it.
